data.title: Track Football Players with Computer Vision
data.description: In this post, we use a YOLOv5 detection model and state-of-the-art tracker ByteTRACK to track football players.

data.title: Preventing Accidents on Construction Sites with Computer Vision
data.description: In this article, we discuss how a community member built a system to prevent accidents on construction sites.

data.title: Studying Links Between Litter and Socio-Economic Factors with Computer Vision
data.description: In this post, we talk about a report that studies links between litter and socio-economic factors with help from computer vision.

data.title: How to Create Segmentation Masks with Roboflow
data.description: In this guide, you will learn how to create segmentation masks with the results of a computer vision model hosted on Roboflow.

data.title: Top 6 Environment Datasets for Computer Vision Projects
data.description: In this article, we highlight six open-source datasets you can use to solve various problems related to the environment with computer vision.

data.title: Roboflow 100  📸
data.description: Roboflow 100 (RF100) is a crowdsourced object detection benchmark. The dataset consists of 100 datasets, 7 imagery domains, 224,714 images, and 829 class labels with over 11,170 labeling hours.

data.title: Turn Analog Dials into Digital Data with Computer Vision
data.description: In this article, we discuss how to turn information displayed on analog dials into digital data.

data.title: What is a Confusion Matrix? A Beginner's Guide.
data.description: In this guide, we discuss what a confusion matrix is and how to use them to evaluate the performance of a computer vision model.

data.title: Monitoring My Caffeine Intake with Computer Vision
data.description: About a month ago, I quit drinking coffee cold-turkey. Up until that point, I regularly consumed coffee, and I had been experimenting with having more coffee in my day because I both enjoyed the taste and the ritual of making coffee. This gradual increase, although initially tasty, was not a

data.title: Monitoring My Caffeine Intake with Computer Vision
data.description: In this post, learn how to build a tool that monitors how many cups of tea or coffee you drink in a day.

data.title: What is Image Classification? A Guide for Beginners
data.description: In this guide, we talk about what image classification is and what problems you can solve with image classification.

data.title: 5 Hobbyist Computer Vision Project Ideas
data.description: This article discusses five ideas of projects you could build to help you learn about computer vision.

data.title: Deploying Machine Learning Models with PyTorch, gRPC and asyncio
data.description: Today we're going to see how to deploy a machine-learning model behind gRPC service running via asyncio.

data.title: What is Transfer Learning? A Guide for Beginners.
data.description: Transfer learning is a computer vision technique where a new model is built upon an existing model.

data.title: What is Zero-Shot Learning? A Deep Dive.
data.description: This post was contributed by Derrick Mwiti, a machine learning developer advocate, for the Roboflow blog. Training computer vision models requires large datasets to obtain good results. However, getting large labeled datasets is often challenging unless a dataset that meets your requirements is already available (which is rare). Consider the

data.title: Using Computer Vision to Save Sea Lions
data.description: This article describes the use of computer vision to help the conservation of the endangered Steller sea lion species.

data.title: How to Use RPA to Supercharge Computer Vision Applications
data.description: This post will walk you through each step in the process to build RPA into your computer vision application.

data.title: Use Docker to Deploy Computer Vision Models
data.description: This blog post is about why you should use Docker in your Deep Learning ecosystem.

data.title: Launch: Roboflow Command-line Interface
data.description: The Roboflow CLI shows information about your workspaces, uploads images and annotations, and performs inference from your command line.

data.title: Top 6 Gaming Datasets for Computer Vision Projects
data.description: Explore the top 6 gaming datasets from Roboflow Universe to build computer vision applications for video games or real world games.

data.title: Top 7 Sports Datasets for Computer Vision Projects
data.description: This post will discuss the top 7 sports datasets available in Roboflow Universe.

data.title: Identifying Objects in Multimedia Databases with Computer Vision
data.description: In this post, we discuss research from Prof. Luigi Laura and Mirko Cangiano showing how to identify objects in multimedia databases.

data.title: Synthetic Data Generation with Stable Diffusion: A Guide
data.description: In this tutorial, we walk through how to generate images with Stable Diffusion for use in a computer vision model.

data.title: Detecting and Reading QR Codes Using Computer Vision
data.description: In this article, we're going to walk through how to detect and read QR codes using Roboflow and Python.

data.title: Overfitting in Machine Learning and Computer Vision
data.description: Overfitting is when a model fits exactly against its training data. The quality of a model worsens when overfitting occurs.

data.title: Top 6 Agriculture Datasets for Computer Vision
data.description: This post will show you 6 of the best open source datasets for computer vision tasks in the agriculture industry.

data.title: Using AI to Count Calories from Photos with SnapCalorie
data.description: See how a mobile application enables users to take a picture of any meal and determine the calories, fat, carbs, and protein.

data.title: School Bus Detection Using YOLOv5 (Tutorial – Part 2)
data.description: Learn how to train YOLOv5 to detect a school bus using Roboflow and CometML

data.title: Blurring Faces to Preserve Privacy with Computer Vision
data.description: This post will show you how to train a computer vision model to detect faces from an image and blur the detected faces.

data.title: Launch: Semantic Segmentation for Labeling, Training, Deployment
data.description: Roboflow now supports semantic segmentation projects end-to-end from labeling, to training, and inference.
